Name: Goal of zero waste to landfill.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the goal of zero waste to landfill
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Summary: The proposed legislation would require the Department of Sanitation to report on the City’s progress toward sending zero waste to landfill.

\pard\ltrpar\noline\sl480\slmult1\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\ulnone\tab Section 1. Subchapter 3 of chapter 3 of title 16 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 16-316.5 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\ul\'a7 16-316.5 Zero Waste plan and reporting.  On or before July 1, 2021, the \cf1 commissioner shall submit to the mayor and speaker of the council a plan to send zero waste to landfill by 2030. On or before July 1, 2022, and annually thereafter, the commissioner shall submit to the mayor and speaker of the council a report on the city\rquote s progress toward the goal of sending zero waste to landfill pursuant to this section. The plan and each report shall include, but need not be limited to:\par
a. A timeline to send zero waste to landfill, including annual targets for waste diversion, disaggregated by waste stream;\ulnone  \ul\par
b. Diversion rates for recyclable material collected curbside by the department, disaggregated by material and by community district;\par
c. Diversion rates for recyclable materials that are not collected curbside, disaggregated by material; \par
d. The department\rquote s plan to increase diversion, which shall include, but not be limited to strategies to increase diversion for each material, strategies to increase compliance with existing law and a description of all education and outreach programs available to the public and strategies to increase or update such education and outreach programs; \par
e. A plan for separate initiatives to increase diversion in residential buildings with various numbers of units, and buildings owned or operated by the New York city housing authority; \par
f. A plan for separate initiatives to increase diversion in commercial establishments; \par
g. A list and description of materials that are not easily diverted from landfill and strategies for eliminating such materials from the waste stream; \par
h. An analysis of the economic market for recyclable materials, disaggregated by material;\par
i. An analysis of current processing capacity for recyclable materials, disaggregated by material;\par
j. An analysis of current availability of capacity at landfills utilized by the city; \par
k. A plan to increase diversion of materials disposed of in public litter baskets; and\par
l. A plan to increase the reuse of materials that would otherwise be disposed of.\par
\pard\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\cf0\ulnone\tab\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately.\par
